page.title: 08SHREWTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: On the other site there is a playing field and the remainder of the school housed in temporary buildings. These are made up of a hall, two classrooms and a kitchen. There is also a third classroom housed in a 'mobile'. In addition there is an outdoor swimming pool with changing rooms built using money raised by parents of children at the school. In July 1985 there were 149 children attending the school organised into five classes. The children enter the school at the beginning of the term in which they become five years old and stay until they are eleven when they transfer to The Stonehenge School in Amesbury.
